snippet.textDisplay:
my fav jrpg series(well, I personally don't count the third).
I wont' spoiler that for anyone, but anyone who has played it knows what i'm talking about...THAT moment in covenant made me cried so damn much. The ending, too. great characters, storyline, music...everything feels great in this game. the only flaw of the first one was the outdated graphics, wich is SPLENDID in the sequel.

snippet.textDisplay:
I have Covenant, but I won't play it until I can play Shadow Hearts. Problem is they're both rather hard to find in person. I actually got Shadow Hearts Covenant by having my Gamestop ship it from  across the country(U.S). Waited 3 weeks. I'll say it's gonna be worth it even if I ultimately shipping, game, and tax had to pay around $90 to get it.
I make this a response comment because frankly I never would've discovered this series(or many others)without this channel. Thank you.

snippet.textDisplay: This is actually like my favourite PS2 RPG and I played it entirely by chance. I enjoyed the third game just fine (even if not quite close to as good), and finally went back to the first game too, not too long ago actually. It really pains me to see the developer essentially vanish, I know they were like sold into Mistwalker or something at some point, or at least helped with Lost Odyssey, but I feel the systems were an imitation at best.
snippet.textOriginal: This is actually like my favourite PS2 RPG and I played it entirely by chance. I enjoyed the third game just fine (even if not quite close to as good), and finally went back to the first game too, not too long ago actually. It really pains me to see the developer essentially vanish, I know they were like sold into Mistwalker or something at some point, or at least helped with Lost Odyssey, but I feel the systems were an imitation at best.

snippet.textDisplay: It's a very underlooked game, unfortunately. If you're interested in playing it, I really recommend playing its direct prequel first, some of the major plot points will make a lot more sense. Just watching this game's opening on YouTube makes me realize how much I miss this series.
snippet.textOriginal: It's a very underlooked game, unfortunately. If you're interested in playing it, I really recommend playing its direct prequel first, some of the major plot points will make a lot more sense. Just watching this game's opening on YouTube makes me realize how much I miss this series.

snippet.textDisplay: Yuri's my favorite protagonist in a jRPG (an anti-hero done right), the game has an outstanding roster of memorable characters, the soundtrack is composed by 3 awesome composers (Hirota, Mitsuda and Ito), the battle system is engaging, the story is a perfect blend of mature, horror and humor that actually works, it takes place on Earth in a unique way in the early 20th century, blood pumping cutscenes and a great variety of intelligent villains. This is why SH: Covenant is one my favorites ever.
snippet.textOriginal: Yuri's my favorite protagonist in a jRPG (an anti-hero done right), the game has an outstanding roster of memorable characters, the soundtrack is composed by 3 awesome composers (Hirota, Mitsuda and Ito), the battle system is engaging, the story is a perfect blend of mature, horror and humor that actually works, it takes place on Earth in a unique way in the early 20th century, blood pumping cutscenes and a great variety of intelligent villains. This is why SH: Covenant is one my favorites ever.
